form.name: form1

p.span: In keeping with the order of Ohio Governor Mike DeWine, RULH Schools are closed for the remainder of the school year due to COVID-19 (Coronavirus).
The current model of remote learning (online and packets) will continue until the regularly scheduled last day of school (Wednesday, May 20).

li.a: Food Service and Child Nutrition Program
Food Service and Child Nutrition Program

img.style: border-width:0px;width: 41px; vertical-align: middle; padding: 10px; border-left: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.12); border-right: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.12);

span.div: The letter below is from RULH Superintendent Jamie Wilkins in regards to the RULH School District's plans for the continued school closure ordered by Ohio Governor Mike DeWine.

div.span: RULH Schools is continuing to offer food distribution to any children age 18 and younger during the mandatory school closure. If you would like food packages prepared for your children, please contact Kim Myers at (937) 392-1527. The dates for food distribution are April 27, May 4, May 11, and May 18. Pick-up locations are at the Higginsport Fire Department, RULH Elementary School (back door/cafeteria), and the Aberdeen Community Center. Pickup may occur on the days indicated from 11:00 a.m. until 12:30 p.m.

span.div: As phase 2 Emergency Learning Packets are made available, they will be posted on each building's page under the Emergency Learning dropdown menu near the top of the district website. Those materials may also be accessed by clicking on the appropriate building below.

If you are interested in enrolling your child for kindergarten at RULH Elementary for fall of 2020, you may do so now by going to the RULH School District website (www.rulh.us) and clicking on the tab labeled "Enroll" or by following this link. All student enrollments for the RULH School District (K-12) can be done there. If you have an incoming preschooler, please use this enrollment form.
If you need further assistance, call the elementary school at (937) 392-1141 and leave your name, number and reason for calling. Someone will be in touch with you within 24 hours of your call.

If you have children younger than school age or soon to enter preschool, the My Pre-K website from United Way of Greater Cincinnati has various useful resources to support their learning and development needs while home during this time of crisis. If you have an incoming preschooler, you can enroll them for the 2020-2021 school year using this enrollment form.
The staff at RULH High School hopes you are safe and well while practicing social distancing. Below are some important dates for upcoming events we plan to have once activities may resume.

div.a: Brown Named RULH Teacher of the Year

span.div: Mrs. Jenny Brown is the 2020 RULH Teacher of the Year! Mrs. Brown will be a candidate for Brown County Teacher of the Year when that award is announced in October.

Mrs. Brown began her teaching career in 2004 at RULH Elementary, taught at Adams County Ohio Valley for 9 years then returned home to RULH in 2015. In addition to her classroom responsibilities, Mrs. Brown is also the RULH Elementary musical director.

She enjoys helping students learn to play the recorders, watching their faces light up when they understand a musical concept, and giving them standing ovations for stellar performances. Mrs. Brown states, “I am blessed to be their teacher.”
Congratulations to Mrs. Jenny Brown!

It's very important that people complete the 2020 Census Survey. It greatly impacts RULH Local Schools and our local communities (Aberdeen, Ripley, and Higginsport). Please read the informational flyer below or click here to complete the census.

div.span: For issues with RULH Chromebooks, students or parents can send a message directly to techhelp@rulh.us. When sending a message, please provide as much detail as possible about the issue. If Chromebook issues cannot be resolved in discussion with Tech Help, it may be necessary to bring the device to one of the RULH school buildings for repair or replacement.

blockquote.a: Ripley Union Lewis Huntington School District

span.div: P. O. Box 85
Ripley, OH 45167

p.span: On behalf of the Treasurer’s Office, welcome to the Ripley-Union-Lewis-Huntington School District. As Treasurer, I am the chief financial officer of the District, responsible directly to the Board of Education for maintaining all financial records and transactions, recording of the minutes, and maintaining custody of all District funds and assets. Here at RULH our entire staff and administrators are dedicated to the education and development of our children. I believe my role in that endeavor is to interpret the educational goals as set by our board and administrators, and match that up with a financial plan that is sound, monitored, and transparent.

In the Treasurer’s Office, we strive to be outstanding stewards of the money entrusted to us by the community and to work to support the excellent work done by the district’s educators and administrators.

span.span: Adjacent to this letter of introduction, you will find links to district finance related forms, board minutes, our five-year financial forecasts that are filed semi-annually with the Ohio Department of Education, and other information regarding the funding of local school districts in Ohio.

If you have any questions or concerns about the finances of the district, please do not hesitate to contact me or a member of my staff. Thank you for the continued opportunity to serve the students, staff, and residents of this great public school district.

div.span: © 2020. Ripley Union Lewis Huntington. All Rights Reserved.
